body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Union County would represent that in the Month of July last John Thompson was arrested, tried and convicted for selling whiskey on the day of the June election and fined forty Dollars for said offence and also twenty dollars for fighting on that day. Mr Thompson is a young man of good character, and has always a peaceable law abiding citizens, never before to our knowledge violated the law by fighting or otherwise and we believe that all which he did on this day was the result of one of those casualties to which the best of young men sometimes subject themselves. We would state there is little money in the country no sales of property can be affected except at ruinous sacrifices and if that $60 fine is permitted to be collected it will bankrupt Mr Thompson completely as it would take property under ordinary circumstances worth near five hundred Dollars to pay it We ask for him a remission of said fine & will ever pray &c

B P Cissell
